meanings.definition: A male figure used as a supporting column or pilaster in architecture.
meanings.sent1: In ancient buildings, atlantes were often carved to look like strong men holding up the roof.
meanings.sent2: The atlantes in the temple were intricately designed to resemble muscular men supporting the structure.
meanings.sent3: The atlantes in the palace seemed to be gossiping about the weight they were carrying on their shoulders.
meanings.sent4: The atlantes stood tall and proud, embodying the strength and stability of the entire building.
meanings.sent5: Visitors to the museum were amazed by the lifelike atlantes holding up the ancient ruins.

meanings.definition: A figure of a man used as a column to support an entablature.
meanings.sent1: The ancient Greeks often used atlantes to add a touch of elegance to their architectural designs.
meanings.sent2: Tourists marveled at the intricate details of the atlantes supporting the grand entrance of the building.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children pretended the atlantes were playing a game of hide-and-seek with the visitors.
meanings.sent4: The atlantes seemed to blend seamlessly with the rest of the structure, almost becoming one with the building.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight cast long shadows of the atlantes on the courtyard, creating a mesmerizing effect.

meanings.definition: A male figure used as a column to support an entablature.
meanings.sent1: Architects in ancient Rome often incorporated atlantes into their designs to symbolize strength and power.
meanings.sent2: The atlantes in the palace courtyard were weathered by time but still stood tall and majestic.
meanings.sent3: Passersby couldn't help but chuckle at the sight of the atlantes seemingly holding up the sky above them.
meanings.sent4: The atlantes appeared frozen in time, forever supporting the weight of history on their shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The intricate carvings on the atlantes told stories of ancient battles and heroic deeds.
